Albania,ALB,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,The information has been received from the official websites of the above mentions institutions.,3.0,1.0,1.0,76.50000000000001,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Open Data Kosovo,Southern Europe,Eastern Europe and Central Asia,Tirana,Tirana,41.3289,19.8178,AL,primary,Capacidades

Angola,AGO,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Angola does not have a data literacy training plan for civil servants. However, in 2018 the executive approved a development plan that will be implemented by 2022.
In one of the plan's chapters, the government states that it will carry out trainings to ensure that civil servants acquire skills in many areas of management.
The same plan is divided into annual strategies that are implemented over 12 months. There is no indication on training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills.
Sources
(1) https://2021-files.globaldatabarometer.org/167/YRvVTX4-Angola_2018_Planning_External_NationalPlan_MinFin_ECCASSADC_Portuguese.pdf

(2): https://governo.gov.ao/ao/noticias/aprovado-plano-de-desenvolvimento-nacional-para-2021/",0.0,0.0,1.0,0.0,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Local Development Research Institute (LDRI),Middle Africa,Africa,Luanda,Luanda,-8.8383,13.2344,AO,primary,Capacidades

Argentina,ARG,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The country has lots of open data activist, civil organization working in open data, open gov movement. Many of them are part of the national Board of the OGP process.

Also, there are some academics actors into the open data environment working closed to OGP National and local plans, National Open Gov policies and open data movement (IE.Conicet,+datalab_UNR,Ciecti,UnCuyo,Ucel,CETYS)
That multiactor ecosytem helps to strengthen the initiatives and supports the governmental policy.
However, the training initiatives for public servants about the topics of the survey are a few cases. The main actor for this is the INAP (Instituto Nacional de la Administración Pública)(1)
The topics about open data, data sharing and data roles can be a task into the new (2021) Federal Plan Program.(2)
Sources:
(1) https://capacitacion.inap.gob.ar/cursos/

(2) Federal Plan, Open Gov Training (2021), Retrieved from https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/comenzo-la-implementacion-del-programa-federal-de-gobierno-abierto",2.0,0.6666666666666666,1.0,40.80000000000001,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,ILDA,South America,Latin America and the Caribbean,Buenos Aires,Buenos Aires,-34.6033,-58.3817,AR,primary,Capacidades

Armenia,ARM,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The Civil Service Office of the Staff of the Prime Minister of the Republic of Armenia is going to offer training for civil servants on Data Collection and Analysis starting from September 2021 (1). The Civil Service Office recognizes data gathering and analysis as a core competency for civil servants (2). The training will have both in-person and remote modules. The training is mandatory for all civil servants of the country. The Public Administration Academy of RA won the bid to conduct the training (3).
Sources
(1): https://cso.gov.am/training-programs
(2): https://cso.gov.am/sections/competence

(3): Phone Interview with a representative of the Civil Service Office of the Staff of the Prime Minister of the Republic of Armenia",0.0,0.0,1.0,0.0,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,IDFI Georgia,Western Asia,Eastern Europe and Central Asia,Yerevan,Yerevan,40.1814,44.5144,AM,primary,Capacidades

Australia,AUS,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The Data Skills and Capability in the Public Service document lists opportunities available for all Australian public servants in technical and non-technical roles; to increase their literacy and/or become experts in data management. These include Fellowships, potential financial support to undertake relevant tertiary education, online modules, and short courses. These appear to be optional and dependent on branch approval.

Anecdotal information gathered through personal correspondence with ex-Australian public servants suggests that although there are efforts in some government departments to formalise data literacy standards into position descriptions this is not uniform across the public sector.
Sources:
1. Department of Prime Minister and Cabinet, 2020, Data Skills and Capability in the Australian Public Service, https://pmc.gov.au/sites/default/files/publications/data-skills-capability.pdf

Azerbaijan,AZE,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Central management in the field of civil service is carried out by the State Examination Center and the Civil Service Management Council. Civil service in the Republic of Azerbaijan: Development Strategy for 2019-2025 is the current document on the organization of training for civil servants (1). The document highlights the importance of data and analytical skills in public servants. However, there is not a specific plan for increasing data literacy among public officials.

The Ministry of Transportation, Communication, and High Tech have ICT Lab – a training center to provide data analytics training to the public officials. ICT Lab has periodically organized training and lectures covering the discussed subject.
Source:

column2: Civil service in the Republic of Azerbaijan Development Strategy for 2019-2025 (23.11.2018)

column1: http://dim.gov.az/upload/iblock/44a/44a5cbe33eb362333ef99f7aa0ce6701.pdf

Bahamas, The,BHS,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The government provides opportunities for the training of public sector workers but there is no evidence that these include data literacy and skills. There is very little information available online on public sector training activities. The listed links are the sources that could be located and had some bearing on  issue under examination. The PSCHRD is responsible for training public servants and conduct ongoing training activities as indicated by the schedule (1). There is, however, no evidence that training involves data skills although the revamping of the national statistical system implies equipping workers with those skills (2).

Benin,BEN,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"In Benin, there is no national training or capacity building process on data for the benefit of civil servants. However, the national statistics institute offers training in statistics (1) for those who are interested, including civil servants.

Learners who do their training at the National Institute of Statistics, obtain a certificate of end of training. There is also training in statistics with the national statistics institute in Cotonou. If you want to take part in their training, you have to live in Cotonou.

Brazil,BRA,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The General Coordination of Governance in Information Technology of the Secretariat for Digital Government is responsible for carrying out the governance of the Information Technology Resource Management System. This work involves the following actions: dialogue with the managers and teams of the Information Technology units; carrying out and supervising periodic individual performance assessment procedures; expansion of the number of servers that work in the digital transformation; and training of professionals in areas of knowledge that are essential for the digital transformation, as defined in the Federal Government's Digital Government Strategy (1).
Capacity Development Program for Digital Transformation (2) Capacita.gov.br, in partnership with Enap, intends to train professionals to support the Digital Government Strategy.

The Program is a partnership between the National School of Public Administration Foundation and the Secretariat for Digital Government (2). The program corresponds to objective 16 of the Digital Government Strategy 2020-2022, which aims to provide technical and managerial capacity for digital transformation, prioritizing seven areas of knowledge, including data science, leadership, and innovation, security and privacy, and focused digital services to the citizen (3).
Sources:
(1) https://www.gov.br/governodigital/pt-br/sisp/governanca-de-talentos
(2) https://www.in.gov.br/web/dou/-/portaria-conjunta-n-6-de-14-de-marco-de-2019-68561375

(3) https://www.in.gov.br/web/dou/-/decreto-n-10.332-de-28-de-abril-de-2020-254430358",2.0,0.6666666666666666,1.0,47.6,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,ILDA,South America,Latin America and the Caribbean,São Paulo,Sao Paulo,-23.55,-46.6333,BR,admin,Capacidades

Bulgaria,BGR,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The Institute of Public Administration (IPA) is a structure of the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Bulgaria and is the leading institution for training of civil servants in the public administration. In the 2019-2021 period it offered between two and five training courses on open data: 2019 E-5 Data bases analysis and visualizations; 2019 OP1 Innovation lab; 2020 P-10 Open data in government; 2020 DK-5 Data bases analysis and visualizations; 2020 DK-6 Data bases analysis and visualizations (advanced); 2021 P13 High-value data sets; 2021 P10 Open data in government: Quality and impact of open data; 2021 DK 5 Data bases analysis and visualizations (basic); 2021 DK-6 Data bases analysis and visualizations (advanced); 2021 OP1 Practical work with open data – upgrading training. All the trainings are listed in further detail in the Institutes respective catalogues for 2019, (1) 2020, (2), and 2021 (3).

These trainings are available to all central executive bodies, as well as to the local government bodies. In the 2019-2021 period all the trainings gathered 68 groups and a total of 1102 trainees which compared to the 570+ executive (including local government) bodies is not a very high coverage.
(1) 2019 IPA Catalogue https://www.ipa.government.bg/sites/default/files/katalog_obuchenia_ipa_2019_online_0_0.pdf
(2) 2020 IPA Catalogue https://www.ipa.government.bg/sites/default/files/ipa_katalog2020_online_0_0.pdf

(3) 2021 IPA Catalogue https://www.ipa.government.bg/sites/default/files/tablica_kursove_proekt_2021.pdf",2.0,0.6666666666666666,1.0,68.40000000000002,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Access Info Europe,Eastern Europe,"European Union, United Kingdom, North America, Israel, Australia and New Zealand",Sofia,Sofia,42.7,23.33,BG,primary,Capacidades

Burkina Faso,BFA,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There is evidence that the government provides training to develop the data knowledge and skills of civil servants. The National Statistics Council provides information showing, for example, several training courses conducted as part of the activities of the National Statistics System (NSS) structures (1). The Public Management and Statistics Support Program (PAGPS), with a ""statistics"" sub-program, also provides information on making quality and sufficiently analyzed statistical data available to users for the design, monitoring and evaluation of development policies and programs (2).

For the National Statistical Council, these trainings are for the benefit of statisticians, any statistical survey designer, statisticians-economists, macroeconomists, planners, or non-statisticians agents of the administration and any user of statistics (1).

Only that by consulting the training courses provided on the website of the National Council of Statistics, the recent year of publication of online training is 2018. But this does not mean that since then there have been no trainings provided just that it is not available in statistical form. Otherwise, it is recognized that the use of statistics is also very varied and very much related to the types of users. Training of some users of statistics has been done in the ARC-SSN and PAR-GS projects. They must be continued and extended within the framework of PAGPS (3). For example, a training workshop on tourism statistics was held in February 2021. This was for civil and political society, related to the field, which aims to raise awareness and train on statistics (4).
Sources :
(1)http://cns.bf/formations.html
(2)http://www.pagps.net/
(3)http://pagps.net/propos.php

(4)https://infosculturedufaso.net/tag/dappui-au-renforcement-des-capacites-du-systeme-statistique-national-arc-ssn/",2.0,0.6666666666666666,1.0,39.60000000000001,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Local Development Research Institute (LDRI),Western Africa,Africa,Ouagadougou,Ouagadougou,12.3686,-1.5275,BF,primary,Capacidades

Cambodia,KHM,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There is some evidence of the Cambodian government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills, although it is not widespread - except for training in operating the Financial Management Information System provided by the Ministry of Economy and Finance to key finance staff at both the national and the sub-national level. (1)(2)(3)

Pursuant to the Statistics Law (4) the NIS has jurisdiction to coordinate statistical development activities, including trainings. However, the NSDS 2019-2023 (5) is the first statistical development strategy. Indeed, the strategy itself (at p17) notes that ""the RGC has not yet focused on statistical development as an important national objective that could be better reflected in the NSDP and national budget, especially with the implementation of the global agenda on sustainable development now under way"".
Sources:

(1) The National Institute of Statistics. 2019. The National Strategy for the Development of Statistics 2019-2023. Royal Government of Cambodia. http://www.nis.gov.kh/index.php/km/2-uncategorised/84-national-strategy-for-the-development-of-statistics
(2) Khmer Times. January 8, 2021. More Than 900 Civil Servants Picked for Skills Training. https://www.khmertimeskh.com/50801677/more-than-900-civil-servants-picked-for-skills-training/

(3) Ministry of Economy and Finance. 2018. FMWG, Oracle and First Cambodia on the Expansion of FMIS Data Center. Royal Government of Cambodia. https://fmis.mef.gov.kh/en/news-en/fmwg-oracle-and-first-cambodia-on-the-expansion-of-fmis-data-center/
(4) Statistics Law. 2015. https://www.nis.gov.kh/nis/For%20Menu/statistics%20law/Statistics%20Law%202015_English.pdf

(5) National Strategy for the Development of Statistics 2019-2023. National Institute of Statistics. http://www.nis.gov.kh/nis/NSDS/NSDS%20book.pdf",2.0,0.6666666666666666,1.0,54.000000000000014,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,East-West Management Institute Inc. Cameroon,CMR,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Statistical units of government ministries and agencies as well as non-technical public officials are heavily involved so as to ensure that the information is a tool for informed decision making in the context of a given public policy.

Chile,CHL,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There is little information about data and open data training for public officials. There is only a record of training from the National Institute of Statistics.
Sources

#1 Technical Conferences of the National Institute of Statistics: https://www.ine.cl/prensa/detalle-prensa/2021/06/22/danielle-zaror-el-principio-fundacional-sobre-protección-de-datos-es-que-estos-pueden-circular-libremente-pero-en-las-condiciones-debidas",1.0,0.3333333333333333,1.0,6.3,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,ILDA,South America,Latin America and the Caribbean,Santiago,Santiago,-33.4372,-70.6506,CL,primary,Capacidades

China,CHN,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There are isolated evidence online proving that there are different types trainings were designed and delivered to public servants on data matters. But there is no planned strategy or consistent training programs at either national level or local level.

The national government issued a 2018-2020 Plan for Public Servants (Carde) Training (1), it listed big data and AI as one of important tool that needs to be leveraged and taugt to public servants. There many different types of training were organized for public servants.

For instance, Jinan City Big Data Bureau organized a data training program with Shandong University targeting public servants within the bureau but also targetting public servants who has data skill in other departments (2). The other example is from Zhejiang University who was commissioned by Shanxi Province Government to deliver training for 52 youth public servants from different level across government departments. (3) In addtion to above two types of training designed for a general purpose on understanding big data and how data might be used in theory ing overnance,  there are also training targeting specific group on specific topic. For instance the National Information Center organized a trainig session in the end of 2019 tagetting public servants who are in charge of data sharing platform across 29 provinces and 62 cities governments (4) on the topic of data sharing policy and platform management.

There might also be quite technical training designed for public servants. One of example known to the public is one of Jingan District government department commissoned a research lab at Fudan university to deliver a 2-month training on big data policy but also specific technical tools and skills (5). But whether there are more training like this is a bit unknown through online search.
(1) 《2018-2022年全国干部教育培训规划》,http://www.gov.cn/zhengce/2018-11/01/content_5336680.htm
(2)市大数据系统干部能力素质提升培训班圆满举办,http://www.jinan.gov.cn/art/2020/11/16/art_52_4762533.html
(3)陕西省青年公务员大数据运用与政府创新管理专题培训班在浙大成功举办,http://www.zju.zj.cn/news1.aspx?id=3584&fl=302&m=4
(4)国家信息中心(国家电子政务外网管理中心)组织召开国家数据共享交换平台标准培训交流会, https://www.ndrc.gov.cn/fggz/gbzj/wsgz/201912/t20191213_1213485_ext.html

(5) 终于等到你,静安人社数据大赛决赛,https://www.sohu.com/a/211290848_729805",1.0,0.3333333333333333,1.0,25.5,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Open Data China,Eastern Asia,South and East Asia,Guangzhou,Guangzhou,23.13,113.26,CN,admin,Capacidades

Colombia,COL,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Circular 3 of 2021 of the Ministry of Information Technologies, the Welfare and Incentives Plan and the Institutional Training Plan for public servants, there is information on training and literacy of data issues and other issues related to technology and innovation, the circular contains a list of training. These trainings have to do with data governance, legal frameworks, use of information systems, data analysis and data visualization.
As they are open call, these sessions do not have specific target audiences.

Estonia,EST,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Estonia is increasingly providing access to trainings for data management, data literacy, and data skills. column1: Finland,FIN,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Act on Information Management in Public Administration mandates training be made available to ""ensure that the personnel and those acting on behalf of the information management entity have adequate knowledge of the provisions, regulations and instructions of the information management entity in force relating to information management, data processing and publicity and secrecy of documents"" (1)

Sub-national training is also widely available. Dataset on trainings to city of Helsinki employees by Oiva akatemia lists multiple occasions of ICT training (""tietotekniikkakoulutus""), including open data training and mandatory data protection training. The dataset covers roughly one third of all training provided. (2)

Majority of the training is provided on a as-needed basis. Training might be provided when new legislation comes into effect, or a project requires understanding of certain topics. These include a wide array of data related topics. (3)
(1): Act on Information Management in Public Administration 906/2019, Section 4(2)(3)
(2): https://hri.fi/data/en_GB/dataset/helsingin-kaupungin-henkiloston-koulutukset

(3): Interview with Miina Arajärvi, Ministry of Finance, Senior Specialist.",3.0,1.0,1.0,63.000000000000014,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Access Info Europe,Northern Europe,"European Union, United Kingdom, North America, Israel, Australia and New Zealand",Helsinki,Helsinki,60.1708,24.9375,FI,primary,Capacidades

France,FRA,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There's no specific trainings on data literacy/skills provided to civil servants in France. However, some categories of civil servants can benefit the training of their choice during their career, in order to change their job specialization or gain skills (1).

The French government has been recruiting data specialists through a public-private program managed by ETALAB: EIG (Entrepreneurs for General Interest) (2). It's annual cohort of data specialists who work to make use of governmental open data.
SOURCES:

THE MINISTRY OF INFORMATION COMMUNICATION AND INFRASTRUCTURE WITH THE ABBREVIATION MOICI DIRECTORATE OF ICT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THESE www.moici.gov.gm",2.0,0.6666666666666666,1.0,61.20000000000001,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Local Development Research Institute (LDRI),Western Africa,Africa,Banjul,Banjul,13.4531,-16.5775,GM,primary,Capacidades

Georgia,GEO,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There is few evidence of the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills. Mainly the annual reports of the State Inspector's Service(1), which contains information about various types of training activities conducted by the agency. Additionally, there is some activity in this regard from CSOs, particularly IDFI that conducts training mainly in municipalities(2), however, due to limited resources this activity is also limited. There is no evidence of a planned and sustainable strategy in this regard.
Sources:
(1):https://personaldata.ge/cdn/2021/05/Report-on-the-activities-of-the-State-Inspectors-Service-2020.pdf

(2):https://idfi.ge/en/idfi_conducted_open_data_training_for_civil_servants_of_gori_lagodekhi_senaki_telavi_and_zugdidi_city_halls",2.0,0.6666666666666666,1.0,47.6,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,IDFI Georgia,Western Asia,Eastern Europe and Central Asia,Tbilisi,Tbilisi,41.7225,44.7925,GE,primary,Capacidades

Germany,DEU,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The open data framework of Germany is currently undergoing reforms. Germany is working on the transposition of Directive 2019/1024 (Open-Data und Public Sector Information Directive). The legislative and governmental work on this is ongoing and several legislative proposals and new strategies were discussed and adopted after May 2021.

The Open Data Strategy (different from the Data Strategy) adopted in July 2021 (1) states that the CCOD is working with the Federal Academy for public servants (Bundesakademie für öffentliche Verwaltung - BAköV) on developing introductory training courses for employees of the federal public administration.
There is currently no evidence that support provided to civil servants goes beyond the guidelines, FAQ and handbook provided by CCOD (2).

Because of the lack of evidence that training exists, the type of support assessed here is the support provided by CCOD through guidelines. Indicators of the elements questions thus refer to the coverage of the support provided by CCOD (especially the handbook on open data).
Extent questions are not applicable in this case because there is no evidence training is taking place. However, the support provided by CCOD covers all public servants (access is not restricted).
SOURCES:

(1) Open-Data-Strategie der Bundesregierung, 2021. Link: https://www.bmi.bund.de/SharedDocs/downloads/DE/publikationen/themen/moderne-verwaltung/open-data-strategie-der-bundesregierung.pdf?__blob=publicationFile&v=3#:~:text=Mit%20der%20Datenstrategie%20will%20die,Deutschland%20und%20Europa%20signifikant%20erh%C3%B6hen.&text=Mit%20der%20vorliegenden%20Open%2D%20Data,Wissenschaft%2C%20Wirtschaft%20und%20Zivilgesellschaft%20auf.

(2) Das Kompetenzzentrum Open Data, n.d. Link: https://www.bva.bund.de/DE/Services/Behoerden/Beratung/Beratungszentrum/OpenData/opendata_node.html",2.0,0.6666666666666666,1.0,11.2,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Access Info Europe,Western Europe,"European Union, United Kingdom, North America, Israel, Australia and New Zealand",Berlin,Berlin,52.52,13.405,DE,primary,Capacidades

Guyana,GUY,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"According to communication with key resource persons in Guyana, some efforts were made by the then government between 2018-2020 to harmonise the government's ICT operations, maintenance, training, procurement, and human resources to improve capabilities and capacities. Honduras,HND,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Different public institutions have promoted training on the subject of data, the Secretariat of Transparency (1) has led the training of public officials with the Diploma of Open Data and Public Information. However, other institutions such as the INE (2), the IAIP (3),  and the High Management School (4)carry out different training sessions, in which they include the subject of data.

There are trainings by private universities, seeing the need for the Government to continue training public employees on specific issues, for example UNITEC develops training focused on public administration.

Hong Kong,HKG,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The Civil Service Training and Development Institute (CSTDI) provides training for civil servants on innovation and technology application including workshops/seminars on big data analytics and open data. The CSTDI also partners overseas and local universities to organise workshops too.

A paper prepared by the Civil Service Bureau (1) states, ""The focus of training for directorate officers and senior managers is to enhance their ability to harness the potentials of new technology and to devise strategies for service innovation. Topics including leadership and innovation, strategies for new technology application, digital government, smart city, design thinking and social media have been incorporated into relevant leadership development programmes."" (1) The stated training is strongly related to but not exactly the same as data frameworks and governance.
Sources:

(1) An Overview of Training and Development for Civil Servants, 2019,  https://www.csb.gov.hk/english//admin/training/files/LCpaper_Overview_20190520_e.pdf",2.0,0.6666666666666666,1.0,39.60000000000001,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,ISOC Chapter Hong Kong,Eastern Asia,South and East Asia,Hong Kong,Hong Kong,22.3,114.2,HK,primary,Capacidades

India,IND,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The National Training Policy, 2012 provides for all civil servants in India to have training to equip them with competencies for their current and future jobs at the time of entry into the service and at multiple times throughout their tenure. Training on data matters for civil servants in India is widespread and includes a foundational course which covers data matters, specific training related to specific data roles is also included in the respective policy, wherever it is needed and also have provision for various MOOCs offered by MIT. Recently, the Government of India announced the  National Programme for Civil Services Capacity Building (NPCSCB) which will further strengthen their technical competencies.
Sources:
Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions.(2012, January 9). The National Training Policy.
https://mes.gov.in/sites/default/files/NATIONAL%20TRAINING%20POLICY%202012.pdf
Press Information Bureau.(2020, September 2). Cabinet approves ""Mission Karmayogi""- National Programme for Civil Services Capacity Building (NPCSCB).

(1) https://www.gov.il/he/departments/publications/reports/storytelling_course",0.0,0.0,1.0,0.0,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Access Info Europe,Western Asia,"European Union, United Kingdom, North America, Israel, Australia and New Zealand",Tel Aviv-Yafo,Tel Aviv-Yafo,32.08,34.78,IL,admin,Capacidades

Italy,ITA,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Italy has embraced the common EU goal of improving and expanding the European digital and data culture (1). Considering that Italy is one of the last countries in Europe for reach and depth of digital skills, a framework on this matter is considered particularly urgent.

In 2020, the country introduced a national plan to support a number of national and local initiatives at the level of schools, universities, companies, and public administration. The multi-stakeholder group Repubblica Digitale (2) manages most of these initiatives which include short courses, training, and scholarships.
However, data skills and competences are only marginally included in this plan and remain quite abstract. Above all, there is no specific initiatives directed at civil servants.
Sources:
(1):https://repubblicadigitale.innovazione.gov.it/assets/docs/national-strategy-for-digital-skills.pdf

Kenya,KEN,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There is some evidence that the government is providing some training through the Kenya School of Government and Public Service Commission. Korea, South,KOR,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"According to Article 25 (Education and Training about Public Data) of the Act on Promotion of the Provision and Use of Public Data, the Minister of the Interior and Safety shall formulate education and training policies to improve the expertise and ability of public officials, executives, and employees of public institutions engaged in managing and providing public data(1). According to Article 19 (Provision of Education and Training about Management and Provision of Public Data) of the Enforcement Decree of the Act on Promotion of the Provision and Use of Public Data, at least once a year, the Minister of the Interior and Safety shall conduct specialized education and training about the management and provision of public data for the public officials and the executives and employees of public institutions under subparagraph 10 of Article 3 of the Framework Act on National Informatization that are engaged in the management and provision of public data under Article 25 (1) of the Act(2).

Thus since 2013, MOIS has been conducting education related to public data quality evaluation through the National Information Society Agency (NIA), a public data-related execution agency. Information related to this training can be found on the Public Data Portal(5).

Since the Korean government already recognizes the importance of data-related capability, the National HRD Institute, which is in charge of educating public officials, is providing a variety of data-related online and offline education(3)(4). Therefore, public officials who want to improve their data-related competency can easily take relevant education if they can meet the education target for each course.
Sources
(1) Act on Promotion of the Provision and Use of Public Data, Article 13, 22, 25, Act No. 17344, June 9, 2020, https://www.law.go.kr/법령/공공데이터의제공및이용활성화에관한법률 (in Korean)
https://elaw.klri.re.kr/eng_service/lawView.do?hseq=47133&lang=ENG (in English, Act No. 14839, Jul. 26, 2017 )

(2)  Enforcement Decree of the Act on Promotion of the Provision and Use of Public Data, Article 19, Presidential Decree No. 31220, December 8, 2020, https://www.law.go.kr/법령/공공데이터의제공및이용활성화에관한법률시행령 (in Korean)
https://elaw.klri.re.kr/eng_service/lawView.do?hseq=47134&lang=ENG (in English, Presidential Decree No. 28211, Jul. 26, 2017)
(3) National HRD Institute,  Introduction to Job/Professional Education for Civil Servants.
(URL) https://www.nhi.go.kr/education/eduList/eduInfomation_5.htm
(4) National HRD Institute, Government e-Learning Platform, http://www.nhi.go.kr/eng/Programs/koreanOfficials/eLearningPrograms/index.htm

(5) Public Data Portal, Notice to public data quality evaluation, https://www.data.go.kr/bbs/ntc/selectNoticeListView.do",3.0,1.0,1.0,59.50000000000001,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Access Info Europe,Eastern Asia,South and East Asia,Seoul,Seoul,37.56,126.99,KR,primary,Capacidades

Latvia,LVA,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"According to the 2019 annual report by Latvia's Public Administration School (1) (a public institution in charge of providing and developing training and consultations for public servants in Latvia), there has been training for public officials on data analysis, visualisation, protection, and other non-technical topics. Similar training courses have been offered by Public Administration School on an ongoing basis, as visible on their training catalogue (2). Quarterly capacity building events about open data for public officials starting from 2020 is one of the objectives included in Latvia's Open Data Strategy (3) adopted by the government in 2019. However, major open data training and public events have been organized by non-governmental and private sector organizations, e.g. conference ""Data Driven Nation"" organized by Latvian Open Technology Association in January 2020 (4).

column1: Liberia,LBR,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The only institution responsible for providing short term training for in-service government workers is the Liberia Institute of Public Administration (LIPA). The institute currently provides a single 4-week course in records and library management. LIPA currently has no course on data literacy and data skills. The deputy director-general of LIPA told the researcher in an interview that there were plans to introduce data literacy in their curriculum.

https://lipa.com.lr/course_details.html",0.0,0.0,1.0,0.0,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Local Development Research Institute (LDRI),Western Africa,Africa,Monrovia,Monrovia,6.3133,-10.8014,LR,primary,Capacidades

Lithuania,LTU,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"In 2020, the Information Society Development Committee launched a centrally managed open data platform for citizens and businesses to access public-sector data and reuse it for both nonprofit and for-profit initiatives (1). The Committee started training public officials on open data already in 2019 (2) and aims to train more in autumn 2021. So far more than 200 officials participated in data trainings (3), their topics ranging from the overview of open data practises in the EU to technical aspects of opening data.
SOURCES:

(1): Open Data Portal, official website, https://data.gov.lt (2): FINAL SELF-ASSESSMENT REPORT ON THE IMPLEMENTATION OF 2018-2020 ACTION PLAN FOR LITHUANIA'S PARTICIPATION IN THE INTERNATIONAL INITIATIVE 'OPEN GOVERNMENT PARTNERSHIP', https://epilietis.lrv.lt/uploads/epilietis/documents/files/Galutinė%20įsivertinimo%20ataskaita%20angliškai.pdf (3): Email to the researcher, official communication with the Information Society Development Committee, 2021 07 26",2.0,0.6666666666666666,1.0,47.6,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Access Info Europe,Northern Europe,"European Union, United Kingdom, North America, Israel, Australia and New Zealand",Vilnius,Vilnius,54.6872,25.28,LT,primary,Capacidades

Malawi,MWI,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There is not a lot of information on the web discussing Malawi government training public servants on issues of data literacy and data skills. The information found thus  far has been in a few documents  discussing  data training for government departments, however  the articles   have not rendered comprehensive information on the specifics of the training  and the features of the data team. The articles and documents  referred herein do not specify the positions of the participants, therefore it cannot be ascertained  whether they were already dealing with data in their line of work  Due to this limited information it has been difficult to establish if the training covers specific technical topics for data centered     roles and if it addresses non-technical public servants. No information regarding the scope of the trainings has been found in any of the desk research. the documents studied have been silent on the matter.
Sources;

column2: Alanna Simpson et al.World Bank Document,Open data for resilience training

Malaysia,MYS,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Training to develop data literacy for public servants is being planned and organized by MAMPU to all ministries at the national level in accordance with the Public Sector ICT Strategic Plan Year 2016-2020 and Public Sector Digitalization Plan Year 2021-2025;

either through the Public Sector Big Data Analytics projects with the aim to enable agencies to have the capability of in-house development of big data analytics in their respective agencies or specific capability/competency development in data matters such as data science/data professionals training/ certification course. URL:
i) https://www.malaysia.gov.my/portal/content/30591
ii) https://www.malaysia.gov.my/portal/content/30646
However, there are budget constraints/limitations.

Due to this issue, these trainings were offered to national public servants from all ministries. State government agencies were not included in Eleventh Malaysia Plan (11MP). In spite of that, universities are offering training to all including sub-national and local public servants.",3.0,1.0,1.0,55.25,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,East-West Management Institute Inc. (EWMI),South-Eastern Asia,South and East Asia,Kuala Lumpur,Kuala Lumpur,3.1478,101.6953,MY,primary,Capacidades

Malta,MLT,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Some evidence of Malta government training initiatives for civil servants emerges through its Institute for the Public Services (IPS) (1). The type of education and training ranges from EU funding to public procurement to working remotely (2). The training and education is not necessarily available to all user groups. Courses usually have target groups and a public servant's application may be rejected if they fall outside this group. Although individuals can apply on their own initiative, they may require approval form their line manager. Alternatively they could be nominated by their line manager for specific training (3). The IPS covers all government sectors nationwide.

column1: Mexico,MEX,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There are different initiatives of the Mexican State from the permanent offer of the National Institute of Transparency, Access to Information and Protection of Personal Data (1) that has the generation of capacities at the regulatory level on government openness from the legal perspective, including open data and the protection of personal data; to more applied initiatives such as the National Public Policy Laboratory (2) of the Center for Economic Research and Teaching, a center of excellence of the National Council for Science and Technology, which offers generation of specific capacities in data mining and the creation of visualizations in its department of interdisciplinary studies (3).

In the same sense, the Ministry of Finance and Public Credit, through the Budget Transparency Portal and its specific section on Face-to-face and distance training (4) annually presents the Massive Open Online Course (MOOC) ""How to understand the budget? Public spending through data "", which focuses on data analysis through basic capacities to understand the budget, in conjunction with Social Tic (5), a leading civil society organization in data activism in Mexico and Latin America.

Nonetheless, we were not able to identify systematic efforts of incorporating data matters in capacity building efforts from the Ministry of Public Administration, which has the mandate to provide capacity building for public civil servants. There was no single available course on their per-registration-only portal for capacity building offer per civil servants: Training System for Public Servants (6).

It is also important to note that even when it is not a centrally organized as a common strategy for all public servants, definitions of open data are part of the core contents of the capacity building plans from the National Institute of Transparency, Access to Information and Protection of Personal Data, which are mandatory for some public servants. Also, it is duly noted that there are several events hosted by government specific agencies, alongside international cooperation agencies and civil society to promote topics related to data literacy and data skills that are available for civil servants.

Moldova,MDA,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The training sessions were part of a series of activities related to the implementation of the National Interoperability Framework and aimed primarily to focus  on the needs of citizens and business, reuse public sector resources and information systems, ensure effective communication between public and private sectors, between central and local public authorities. (1)

In 2020, the Government adopted a resolution on the creation of an e-Learning platform. (2) The governmental e-Learning platform (hereinafter - the e-Learning platform) is an information system platform, part of the state information resources of the Republic of Moldova, intended to provide individuals and legal entities under public law and under private law an efficient, reliable and modern employee training mechanism by creating, developing, and making available online training resources as well as granting employees access to information for their professional development. At the moment of analysis, a training on informational security was available on the platform. (3)
Source:
1) Training on data access for central public authorities, 2021 https://egov.md/ro/communication/news/instruiri-privind-accesul-la-date-cu-acces-autorizat-pentru-autoritati-publice
2) Government Decision No. 411, 2020
https://www.legis.md/cautare/getResults?doc_id=122270&lang=ro

3) Governmental E-learning platform https://elearning.gov.md/",2.0,0.6666666666666666,1.0,8.4,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,IDFI Georgia,Eastern Europe,Eastern Europe and Central Asia,Chisinau,Chisinau,47.0228,28.8353,MD,primary,Capacidades

Mongolia,MNG,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Overall, there is isolated evidence of the government supporting civil servants' training on data matters. Although the Government of Mongolia has approved the short and mid-term training programs for civil servants in 2019, the training program doesn't include any training on open government and open data(1).

Instead, the Cabinet Secretary of the Government of Mongolia has organized several trainings on open data and IT-for government officers who work in IT-related departments. Especially, the Cabinet Secretary of Government of Mongolia has a dedicated division, Information Technology Division(2). The division is responsible for developing and running state information systems and digitizing public services. But trainings are mainly organized and supported by projects focused on the e-governance initiatives including Smart Government Project' funded by the World Bank. Trainings are organized with the support of the Smart Government Project at the request of the Government Cabinet Secretariat of Government of Mongolia and IT companies are organizing several trainings for government officers in IT-related departments(3).

Although there is a platform for government officers created by the MERIT project(4), the platform is inactive and has limited training course materials(5). The Cabinet Secretariat of the Government of Mongolia has uploaded contents of the training courses including ᠋Results-oriented policymaking and Monitoring and Evaluation (M᠊&E)' into the online training platform for government officers(6). Also, the Cabinet Secretariat of the Government of Mongolia has organized the training in cooperation with the MERIT project.
Sources:
(1) Short term and Mid-term training program for civil servants, 2019, https://legalinfo.mn/mn/detail/14574

(2) Information Technology Division https://cabinet.gov.mn/sector/%d0%bc%d1%8d%d0%b4%d1%8d%d1%8d%d0%bb%d0%bb%d0%b8%d0%b9%d0%bd-%d1%82%d0%b5%d1%85%d0%bd%d0%be%d0%bb%d0%be%d0%b3%d0%b8%d0%b9%d0%bd-%d1%85%d1%8d%d0%bb%d1%82%d1%8d%d1%81-2
(3) News on Training https://cabinet.gov.mn/5438.html?lang=en
(4) Introduction to the MERIT project. http://portal.merit.mn/en/
(5) https://training-mongolia.thinkific.com

(6) https://training-mongolia.thinkific.com/courses/rbm",1.0,0.3333333333333333,1.0,16.200000000000003,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,IDFI Georgia,Eastern Asia,Eastern Europe and Central Asia,Ulaanbaatar,Ulaanbaatar,47.9203,106.9172,MN,primary,Capacidades

Morocco,MAR,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The Moroccan Digital Development Agency mentioned that they are working on a large project titled ""Digital Generation"" project. The project consists of setting up a national digital training program to include new digital professions in higher education, continuing education, vocational training and scientific research as well as promoting digital culture among young people and citizens. There is no indication if the project will include training on data matter specifically, however this should be available as part of objective of improving the employability of Moroccans by training them for the jobs of tomorrow. (1)
## References

Mozambique,MOZ,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There are no public initiatives on open data production and access. However, it is known that the country is preparing a biometric data system that can facilitate access to public and private services in Mozambique.

The National Communications Institute announced in April 2021 that data is the basis for digital identity. Biometric data will allow registration through fingerprints, voice, facial features, behavioral gestures, and genetic material of the person.
We note that Mozambique does not have an annual training plan for its civil servants, although there are specialised training schools for public servants.
Sources
(1) https://www.dw.com/pt-002/como-mo%C3%A7ambique-entra-na-era-da-identidade-digital/a-57103717

(2) www.maefp.gov.mz",0.0,0.0,1.0,0.0,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Local Development Research Institute (LDRI),Eastern Africa,Africa,Maputo,Maputo,-25.9667,32.5833,MZ,primary,Capacidades

Namibia,NAM,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"This is one of the isolated cases under which government trainings on data is targeted to Civil servants has been reported.  However it is fair to assume that government in general have been rolling out training for officials on data Maning since data has increasingly become a large part of the government business.
Additionally a new Revenue Agency was recently launched during the years under review, and in particular is enforcing  Online filing of taxations, this means that new data skills had to be developed
Sources:
1. Namibia Statistics Agency, 2020, available at https://d3rp5jatom3eyn.cloudfront.net/cms/assets/documents/Media_statement_Covid_Hub1.pdf

2. New Era Newspaper, (2019) Recruitment Agency to commence soon,  https://neweralive.na/posts/recruitment-for-revenue-agency-to-commence-soon",1.0,0.3333333333333333,1.0,20.4,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Local Development Research Institute (LDRI),Southern Africa,Africa,Windhoek,Windhoek,-22.57,17.0836,,primary,Capacidades

Nepal,NPL,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The Nepal Administrative Staff College [1], which is the national level autonomous institution responsible for providing necessary training on career development for the employees of the Government of Nepal and Public Enterprises doesn't have any dedicated curriculum and training program to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills. But there is isolated evidence of the government supporting civil servants' training on data matters, usually by attending and supporting the training program organized by civil society. The various departments of the government agencies have been supporting events [2] and have collaborated to organize national level substantive training [3]. There is a lack in the reach, due to which the gap of skill sets  between government officers is seen, but the CSOs are frequently organizing the national level sensitization events [4] and developing required resources via projects like Open Data Awareness Program [5], Nepal Data Literacy Program [6], etc.
[1] Nepal Administrative Staff College: https://www.nasc.org.np/
[2] Open Nepal - Event page: http://opennepal.net/events
[3] National Substantive Training on Open Government Data for Sustainable Development: https://publicadministration.un.org/en/news-and-events/calendar/ModuleID/1146/ItemID/2902/mctl/EventDetails
[4] Sustainable use of Technology for Public Sector Accountability in Nepal - Event page: https://susasan.org/events
[5] Open Data Awareness Program: http://odap.oknp.org/

[6] Nepal Data Literacy Program: https://dataliteracy.github.io/",1.0,0.3333333333333333,1.0,14.7,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,East-West Management Institute Inc. (EWMI),Southern Asia,South and East Asia,Kathmandu,Kathmandu,27.71,85.32,NP,primary,Capacidades

Netherlands,NLD,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There is no standard, centralized training that civil servants and government organisations go through, but there are lots of initiatives and platforms that are at their disposal if they wish to use them to find information, or develop knowledge and skills. For the most part, government initiatives to train civil servants on data matters are laid down in NL DIGITAL: Data Agenda Government. The objective of this agenda is to promote the sharing, combining and analysis of data through cooperation between governments. The element consists of five elements, the last two of which are relevant here: 4. Collecting and sharing knowledge on working data-driven,  and 5. Investing in people, organisations and culture change'. (1) As part of number 4, the Learning and Expertise Center Data-driven working (LED) was set up. Here, best practices, methods and techniques and knowledge about data-driven working are collected and shared. (2) For example, they created the Data Governance Self-assessment tool, consisting of 43 questions on 8 themes, determining the position and ambition of a government organisation when it comes to data governance. Also, in 2020 LED launched the 'Toolkit Data-driven Working', with methods, techniques, prerequisites, best practices, case studies, interviews, tips from experts, information on ethical and legal aspects, et cetera. (3) Another example included in the Data Agenda Government, is the Den Bosch Data Week that the Ministry of Interior Affairs supports. This week is about showing government organisations and other target audiences what the social value of data can be. (4) Also, different knowledge conferences are organised by different government organisations. (5)

Element 5 of the Data Agenda focuses on recruiting new talent, education, training and development of civil servants, setting up an infrastructure of datalabs and data science workspaces, promoting better data management, and changing the way of working within government organisations. For instance, government organisations are being encouraged to hire a Chief Data Officer and develop a data strategy, like more and more public bodies are doing. The Directorate CIO State is developing a blueprint for the role of Chief Data Officers. (6) Furthermore in 2019 the National Academy for Digitalisation and Computerisation in Government (RADIO) has launched an e-learning module on the impact and opportunities of digitisation for policy staff. They also organise different seminars, webinars, podcasts, e-learnings, access to Digi-Coaches, LinkedIn-groups, and courses to teach civil servants about data, cyber security, AI, digital skills, et cetera. (7) Also, in 2019 the government, together with the Technical University of Delft, started the Digicampus, where scientists, government bodies, businesses and citizens work together on digital government innovations to improve public service, including through use of data. (8) Furthermore, the Ministry of Interior Affairs and the Association of the Netherlands Municipalities, are developing international framework guidelines for responsible data use, through the working group 'Data Driven Public Sector' of the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD), which is chaired by the Netherlands. (9) For more examples, see the NL DIGITAL: Data Agenda Government (file attached).

Additionally, there's the Learning and Expertise Point Open Government, which is focussed on sharing knowledge and experiences when it comes to open data. They offer tools and instruments and bring civil servants in contact with experts. For example, through the project 'Breakthrough with Open Data', open data relays were organised, where NGOs, governments and other stakeholders came together to solve social issues with data. Furthermore, they offer an Open Data Toolkit, with i.e. a roadmap and practical tips to get started with open data. (10)

Lastly, the national data platform, Data.government.nl, offers open data knowledge and technical support. For example through the Open Data Guide, that civil servants can use to achieve open data within their organisation. (11)
(1) Digitale Overheid, 'Data Agenda Overheid', https://www.digitaleoverheid.nl/overzicht-van-alle-onderwerpen/nieuwe-technologieen-data-en-ethiek/data-agenda-overheid/.
(2) Digitale Overheid, 'Data Governance Self-Assessment tool', https://www.digitaleoverheid.nl/document/data-governance-self-assessment-tool/.
(3) Digitale Overheid, 'Toolbox data-driven working', https://www.digitaleoverheid.nl/dossiers/toolbox-datagedreven-werken/.
(4) DataweekNL, https://dataweeknl.nl/.
(5) Digitale Overheid, 'NL DIGITAL Data Agenda Government', 2020, p. 26-27 (file attached).
(7) RijksAcademie voor Digitalisering en Informatisering Overheid, https://www.it-academieoverheid.nl/.
(8) Digicampus, https://digicampus.tech/.
(9) Digitale Overheid, 'NL DIGITAL Data Agenda Government', 2020, p. 31 (file attached).
(10) Leer- en Expertisepunt Open Overheid, https://www.open-overheid.nl/.

(11) Data.overheid.nl, 'Handreiking open data', https://data.overheid.nl/handreiking-open-data/",3.0,1.0,1.0,38.25,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,Access Info Europe,Western Europe,"European Union, United Kingdom, North America, Israel, Australia and New Zealand",Tilburg,Tilburg,51.55,5.0833,NL,minor,Capacidades

New Caledonia,NCL,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There is evidence that the government is providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills.  Training is delivered primarily by a dedicated government organisation - the Institute of Public Administration Training (IFAP). Training is also occasionally delivered by external suppliers and experts from overseas.

Courses offered by IFAP cater for non-technical public servants, servants already working with data, including advanced training, training delivered covers specific technical topics for data centred roles.

New Zealand,NZL,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The government has a strategy(1) and framework(2) to establish sustainable data capability across government. The Data Leadership team at StatsNZ has responsibility for this training(3). There is no online evidence that regular training has been provided. Data practice communities exist for Open data community forums, Government analytics network and Data and digital standards communities of practice (4).

Nigeria,NGA,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There is some evidence showing the Government's plan to prioritize digital literacy in the Country (1). On the other hand, states like Kaduna State have already kickstarted initiatives to develop the skills of public servants in digital literacy and data analysis (2).

Oman,OMN,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Omani government provides training to their civil servants through the institute of capability development (1). The only digital program available in this institute is the Digital fluency Program (2). The program focus on The future of work and the new economy,  Readiness for the future, Digital literacy, Government innovation, and Digital security. However there is no indication if  data literacy and data skills are part of such program.

Paraguay,PRY,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Civil servants in 15 public institutions received trainings about open data during the relevant time-frame for this study (1). In an interview, Open Government Director at the ICT Ministry, Derlis Meza, explained that most of the trainings were provided virtually due to the pandemic. Hence, there are no URLs or articles to these events. He clarified that they have 3 types of training: a. Introduction to open data, b. Prioritizing data that could be published, and c. Opening and publishing data. According to Meza, most trainings are about the first 2 topics, while the third happens rarely for public agencies willing to publish data. Hence, most trainings are open to technical and non-technical staff.
Sources

(1) Interview with Derlis Meza, Director, Open Government Directorate, ICT Ministry.",1.0,0.3333333333333333,1.0,22.95,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,ILDA,South America,Latin America and the Caribbean,Asunción,Asuncion,-25.3,-57.6333,PY,primary,Capacidades

Peru,PER,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Regarding the training that would be provided to public servants, it is part of the National Strategy for Open Governmental Data of Peru 2017-2021 (1) whose line of action refers to 1: Establishment of the institutional and regulatory framework. In addition, courses on information management are becoming evident: ""Course: Induction in Geo-Information Management and Implementation of Spatial Data Infrastructures""(2) and Course: Geodata Management System, distribution of Geonode-Peru of the Digital Government Secretariat (3) and new courses that the Presidency of the Council of Ministers intends to launch (4) PCM: Announces intensive courses on digital services and innovation for digital transformation. One of the entities in charge of providing the courses for the public sector is the national school of public administration (5), which will be required to deliver a certificate upon completion of a course. Evidence will be needed as courses, workshops and other training on open data continue to be implemented.

Philippines,PHL,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Possibly due to the COVID-19 pandemic, training for civil servants on data literacy and skills were not done that much in 2020-2021 compared to other years amid skeleton workforces and shift in focus to address the pandemic. While the government encourages civil servants to take online learning and development opportunities instead (1), the challenge to participate on such when internet connection is still a challenge for some (2) makes it unfeasible for most.

Some training opportunities also exist but with paid attendance, which adds another barrier for accessible learning toward professional development. The challenge now for capacity-building agencies like the Development Academy of the Philippines would be to keep these training opportunities cheap or free and accessible to all public servants across the country.
Sources:

Portugal,PRT,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Although Portugal still ranks poorly in digital qualification when compared to EU average, there has been some important work already accomplished in order to improve the situation.
There are mainly

A national initiative called (1) INCoDe.2030, which embodies a dedicated team, sets the long-term goal to improve the level of digital skills of the Portuguese people in a time frame that extends to 2030. This initiative has, for example, led to the creation of (2) ""Centro de Competências Digitais da Administração Pública (TicAPP)"" which specifically deals with digital competences of public servants.
The agency that implements all training is INA. (3)
In 2020 the government launched Portugal Digital, an action plan designed to be the country's digital transformation engine (4).
(1) INCoDe.2030 https://www.incode2030.gov.pt/
(2) TicAPP https://ticapp.gov.pt/en/
(3) Website of INA https://www.ina.pt/

Rwanda,RWA,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"There is no standalone training scheme for data literacy and data skills designed for civil servants, but the country disposes a single framework for capacity development that is inclusive for all domains. Capacity building efforts in Rwanda have been characterized by standalone, overlapping and duplicative interventions, leading to inefficiency and wastage of resources. In response to this challenge was the development of Multi-Sector Capacity Building Programme which was set up in 2001 (1);

12 years later, the Programme was transformed into National Capacity Building Secretariat with the mandate to strengthen the national workforce and organizations that deliver quality services to achieve national development agenda (2);

Again in 2018, in order to make capacity development more professional, the secretariat was changed into Chief Skills Office under Rwanda Development Board which is mandated to provide effective oversight and coordination in the skills development and employment promotion ecosystem throughout the whole Rwanda (3).
Sources:
(1) Rwanda country report, 2007. Capacity
development and building a Capable state, Page

building-secretariat-profile_b5603e71f622f0b5

Slovakia,SVK,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"National Data office (DataLab) (1) provides trainings for public officials and organizes individual meetings.  Participants receive a certificate of completion of the training, which is delivered by and certificates are issued by the data office.

The training does not seem to place specific restrictions regarding the technical role and ability of the public servants and most of the resources are available to everyone via video recordings on a Youtube channel of the DataLab team. (2)

South Africa,ZAF,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"No official government policy or strategy was found which caters for data literacy training for civil servants. The only item found to somehow refer to data literacy was the National Digital and Future Skills Strategy released in September 2020 (1). However, the strategy does not explicitly refer to data literacy training for civil servants. Instead, it refers mainly to enhancing digital skills (including data literacy) for the greater population of South Africa in order for the country to be well-positioned to effectively participate in the 4IR (1). With regards to this, the strategy seems to be more geared towards school curriculums and tertiary education.

At a city level, as implied earlier, the City of Cape Town is the only city with an open data policy and active open data initiative. However the city does not have any strategy in place to cater for data literacy training for civil servants.

Spain,ESP,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"INAP (1) encourages lifelong learning to develop the skills of Public Administration employees throughout their professional careers. The IV Open Government Action Plan of Spain (2) includes the compromise to develop competencies of public employees in matters of open government commitment, 7.4. INAP assumes that commitment with conviction and it has resulted in the creation of the II Open Government Training Plan (2021 - 2024) (3).
It should be noted that this plan only includes programmable training activities and not all the conferences etc. that the entity organizes.

In INAPS Training Plan for 2021, page 26 (4) onwards contains an extensive list of courses that cover many different areas of open data and government and also different technical courses, the IV open government action plan also states that Public  Administration staff will be trained   on  the  conceptual  bases,  values,  tools  and  strategies  of  Open  Government which will allow a greater number of civil servants to know what open government is and to provide them with tools to  put these ideas into practise, thus contributing to the transformation of its work environment.
INAP also organises different conferences and seminars for the public sector (5)

column1: Sri Lanka,LKA,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"The Department of Census and Statistics (DCS) of Sri Lanka is supposed to provide trainings including some on data science/statistics (1), and the Government e-Learning Platform also has some relevant course material (2). It should be noted that course information available to the public online is quite limited (usually a description of few lines at most) and I was not able to find detailed syllabus information online. The above questions were answered with whatever can be found online and is available to the public.

The Draft National Digital Policy mentions ""Enhanc[ing] the digital skills of public sector officers"", which involves ""Digital training for Government officers to perform in a digitalised work environment and support the Government's e-Government plans"" (pg. 9)(3). The ICT Agency of Sri Lanka notes that the Government ICT Training project, under the Reengineering Government Programme, ""would equip around 10,000 government officers with ICT knowledge and skills in the near future"" (4). These point to plans / intentions to build the digital capacity of government employees in the future more generally. Perhaps they will encompass data literacy and data skills.
Sources:
(1) DCS http://lms.statistics.gov.lk/
(2) GELP courses  https://www.gelp.gov.lk/Catalog/Courses
(3) Draft National Digital Policyhttps://kdu.ac.lk/ekdu/images/acts/Draft_National_Digital_PolicyFINAL07102019.pdf

(4) ICT Agency of Sri Lanka https://www.icta.lk/projects/government-web-development-and-government-internet-data-center-gidc/",1.0,0.3333333333333333,1.0,33.15,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,0.0,51025.0,0.12,0.0288,0.095,East-West Management Institute Inc. Tillitsdelegationen published a report about
A joint education within the public agencies"", its content did not mention data literacy and data skills be included in education to public agencies. (2)
In Sweden's national data strategies, there are no mentions of data literacy and data skills being included in education to public agencies. (3)

This service is offered through the Public Service Academy.   A roster of training courses for March 2021 to May 2021 shows no training courses pertaining to data (1).
Training statistics for 2019-2020 highlight that no data related courses were delivered (2).

Some civil servants are given time off and sabbaticals to attend courses of their choosing at The University of the West Indies. This can include data courses. Data education and training programmes exist through the University of the West Indies in 'Foundations of Data Management and Analysis' and Certificate in Fundamentals of Statistical Analysis Techniques (3) and (4).
The UWI St. Augustine Campus has a MSc. Data Science (5 ).

Turkmenistan,TKM,Capabilities,CAPABILITIES,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,Capability (C): Civil service,Primary,C.CAPABILITIES.TRAIN,To what extent is the government providing training to develop civil servants' data literacy and data skills?,1,response,"Following the adoption of the digitalization strategy in late 2018, Turkmenistan has taken measures to improve public servants' data literacy and skills. The Academy of Civil Service was defined as the principal institution to perform this task; the institution's activities in this strand are supported by the UNDP and EU that provide capacity-building technical assistance. In May 2019, Turkmenistan's public servants of all levels were ordered to undergo short training in the ""basics of the digital economy"" (1). In March 2020, the Academy launched a pilot program on Digital Management for 20 participants (2), and in 2021, it awarded the master's degree in Digital Management to the first group of graduates (3). The Academy's Master's program in Public Administration also contains a module on e-governance. Separately, OSCE and USAID also conduct short training courses on using information and communication technologies in public administration for public servants (4, 5). Despite these positive developments, the overall progress has been minimal and slow thus far. The training initiatives remain mostly short-term and isolated and involve a handful of national-level public servants. The lack of detailed and reliable information about the quality of state-sponsored training programs and their positive impact is another noticeable shortcoming.
